event.title: listed on a blueprint map of the Alaska Railroad in 1917

data.event: Houston Siding was first listed on a blueprint map of the Alaska Railroad in 1917.

event.title: was incorporated as a fourth-class city in 1966

data.event: Houston was incorporated as a fourth-class city in 1966.

event.title: overhauled its local government structure in 1972

data.event: It remained an incorporated city after Alaska overhauled its local government structure in 1972, which saw the elimination of the fourth-class city designation and the dissolution of many cities so incorporated.

event.title: 1972, George Boney, the chief justice of the Alaska Supreme Court and at the time the youngest chief justice of any U.S. state supreme court, died

data.event: Also in 1972, George Boney, the chief justice of the Alaska Supreme Court and at the time the youngest chief justice of any U.S. state supreme court, died in Houston (at Cheri Lake) in a boating accident which resulted in drowning.
